message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of local testing for membership in lattices, which has applications in integer programming, error detection in lattice-based communication, and cryptography. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories, including Information Theory (cs.IT), Computational Complexity (cs.CC), Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS), Cryptography and Security (cs.CR), and Machine Learning (cs.LG). However, since the paper focuses on the theoretical foundations of lattice testing and provides upper and lower bounds on query complexity, it is most likely to belong to cs.IT and cs.CC.
